website_summaries.verdict: The best budget memory card reader with more speed and reliability than comparable options.
pros: Small enough to fit in a pocket or bag
Connects to a computer like a regular USB stick without the need for extra USB cords
Fast enough for large media files
cons: Large body on the reader gets hot quickly when working at full capacity

customer_reviews.title: FIRE HAZARD * WARNING This can be the cause for your next Home or Office Fire
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this Dangerous product. It may have a lot of +Reviews but do not be fooled. This can easily burn your family's home or business down to the ground because it runs hot (as many comments report). But it also MELTS your micro SD cards (which you won't get your money back on). You should definitely stay away from this Dangerous Product. We have reported this item and submitted photos to help anyone on the fence about buying this product. Also be especially careful not to purchase anything from seller MemoryWhiz the seller ship defective hazardous returned products that were likely meant for disposal. Dangerous situation Experienced here. STAY Away. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trumor

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool in your mobile arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transfer data from a 64GB SanDisk micro SD card to a 64GB Transcend micro SD card newly installed in my BlackBerry Z30. I paired it with a StarTech USB to USB OTG host adapter. This sucker is F*A*S*T. It quickly transfered over 26GB of music, 4 GB of photos and a bunch of other stuff. The phone immediately sees the USB connection and the SD data is accessible via file manager. I then popped my camera's SD card in to copy the photos I took of the setup over to the phone (uploaded for this review). Needless to say it worked great on a PC too. Tiny Powerhouse should be its name.
customer_reviews.author: Silvana D.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy something better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SD card reader after reading all the positive reviews on Amazon. I bought it June 24, 2017. It's Sept 2, 2017 and this reader has already stopped reading cards. I'm not a heavy user, although I am a photographer, so if you are also a photographer, stay away. This reader also gets very, very hot when reading cards.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously Hot, Introduces Corruption
customer_reviews.text: Used this Transcend SD Card Reader intermittently for years. Noticed that my SD cards were generating errors and when I finally got around to running some tests, noticed how dangerously hot the adapter was getting. Kept thinking it was the cards that were the problem, until I replaced this with the Satechi USB-C UHS-II reader ... the difference was night and day. Previously "bad" cards tested fine, and could work in heavy testing for 5+ hours without even getting warm to the touch. This is too old now for a refund, so it's going into the trash before it causes real damage and potentially a fire. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: The reader becomes too hot after few seconds use.
customer_reviews.text: I have the following SDHC and File Specs below: SDHC Transfer Speed: 90 MB/s Content size: 11.38GB worth of raw files from my DSLR I have used other brands and moved raw files greater than what I've used for testing this product but it does not heat up like this one though. File transfer is fast to be fair. I might update this review if I can when I have all data re transfer speed rate in comparison to other types and brands.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Rosa D. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy, Fast, Excellent Price!
customer_reviews.text: For under $10 you cannot beat this USB 3.1 SDHC/SDXC/microSDHC/SDXC Card Reader deal! transfers 4gbs in under 35 seconds! It's an absolute must have for the computer if you don't have included SD card slot. as the title says Quick, Easy, Fast, Excellent Price!! **If you liked this quick little review or if it helped curve your opinion before buying it, please hit the helpful button down at the bottom! Thanks for reading my review!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Stratford

customer_reviews.title: It made us cry!!
customer_reviews.text: I have several old sd cards that I had found in an old desk recently and had no idea what I had on them, so I purchased this little reader. It can plug into my monitor usb slot when I need it and be put away easily when not in use. I've discovered old photos of my dad, who passed away 10 years ago, that I had forgotten about...and even a video with him talking and laughing on those old cards. Finding and sharing those with my family made us all cry getting to see and hear my dad again. To me, this little device is priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of hockey videos that needed migrated from the SD cards to youtube - this reader worded awesomely and with no problems at all. Given the time (@1-2 hours) in the USB slot [because I had to process the videos while on the SD card to produce a share-able video], I was concerned about heat and melting of SD cards based on other reviews. I ran a small desk fan pointed at the device while it was attached to my computer and I never had a problem and it never seemed too warm. In fact I left the device connected overnight a couple of times with the extra fan running and had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Portable USB 3 card reader.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quick review of the USB 3.0/ USB 3.1 Gen 1 A great priced device first off. Frustration free packaging. Nice simple clean design. Well as you know I'm a photographer. I also shoot video. My new custom video PC has USB’s in the back and some on top. This helps me from crawling around the back on the floor. I'm sure have a built in SD and micro SD on my PC would have helped, but poor planing on my part. This solved my problem and worked perfectly. Recommended and use daily. Hope this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Schafer

customer_reviews.title: compact, inexpensive, and handy
customer_reviews.text: I had an old memory card reader from years ago that I've been using mostly to transfer pictures from digital cameras. Over the years, with more devices using memory cards (dashcams, tablets, phones, etc), I've continued to use the old reader. The old reader just couldn't cut it anymore since it was a very old USB version - it was so slow compared to USB 3+ options. I did some looking around and settled on this as my new reader, so far I've been really happy with it Pros: - compact - cover for usb connector - support for SD and micro SD - inexpensive - good performance Cons - no cover for SD and micro SD slots
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Compact, works quickly and handy for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back, and I now want another one just to keep at the home computer. Because it's so inexpensive – why not. So, I'm about to purchase my second one, and decided to write a review. What I like about the Transcend USB memory card reader is that it is compact, it is easy to take with you anywhere and it works well. I love that it has a cap that protects the USB port plug. I like that it allows two-sizes of memory cards to read. I've been working as a reporter, and this reader has been great for carrying with me everywhere so that I can quickly download photos and video.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: How to prove that the HEAT this thing generates has fried 3 of my cards?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what say. 3 cards in a row, working perfectly fine in my phone. Time to download data, take cards out, put them onto the PC, and all of a sudden a sign comes on saying that they are corrupted and require fixing. All the cards became locked into read only mode, different brands. Strange, I thought. Then I touched this device and realized how freaking HOT it gets. It has been hot for years, but I didn't suspect it would be the cause of all my fried cards. Beware guys, if this thing even remotely gets warm I would not trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: They just always work!
customer_reviews.text: I have about three of these because I have confidence in them. Other brands have been a hit and miss for me often not working at all or seeming to work only to discover later that they didn't transfer data without errors. This Transcend just always works! Never had a problem and speed is acceptable though I've not actually tested for performance. Different colors are nice to have if you own more than one especially if you're working with two unmarked micro XD cards. Can be found as an add/on item with a small discount if you look.
customer_reviews.author: Freebird

customer_reviews.title: I got the bad one of the batch I guess...  :-(
customer_reviews.text: Wow.. Based on the reviews I must have gotten a bad one. This reader is a thin plastic, feels like it's going to come apart at the seams and WONT read a card at all. Well, it did once. But I can't get it to do it again. Moved to different ports on the PC as well as a different computer but nothing. There is a little play with the SD Card in the slot and I was thinking that was it..but no. Not sure what it is. By the look of the thousands of positive reviews they must work. But I got a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Too big for technology today
customer_reviews.text: I had a kingston usb adapter which went bad. It was of the size of two micro sd cards put together and it was awesome. So, I ordered this transcend adapter because there weren't any other reliable ones in the market. From the pictures it looked small, but it is not. It is actually bigger than I expected and can't be put in a keychain for everyday use. I still have it because I use it with my projector to play movies, but I recommend finding others that are smaller and faster to use with the technology available today.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Insanely Useful
customer_reviews.text: I love these adapters, I now own 4 of them and keep one with me at all times. They're great for reviewing files from my phone, camera, GoPro, and dashcam if I don't have whatever cables would normally be needed with me. I find them most useful for my dashcam and always keep one in my glove box. This way, when I capture an incident (I've already got three good ones over the last couple of years that were needed for law enforcement and insurance) I can immediately remove the micro SD card and transfer the file(s) to a desktop or laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: So wide it blocks neighboring USB slots
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this one star as it will not work well when USB slots are side by side along the width of the USB slots. This form factor consumes three USB slots. If you are using in slots that are vertical like on the back of a computer it may work but that will depend on what other connections are next to the USB stack.
customer_reviews.author: Theta

customer_reviews.title: great simple connector for SD cards to USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Whenever possible I prefer to use a SD card slot for my SD cards, but laptop manufacturers are frequently changing their ports. My new laptop for work has a very inaccessible SD card slot, so I usually find it a lot easier to use this to mount the card via the USB port. Very simple, reliable and versatile.
customer_reviews.author: brobeta

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: At about $7.50, this is a reasonably priced option for transferring SD card data to your computer. It's simple, easy to use, and effective. I've already used it twice with no snags.My old adapter was more protective... but the Transcend model also handles Micro SD cards, so there's a trade-off. And I have a camera that uses Micro SD cards. The bottom line is it works. It's simple, requires zero learning, and gets the job done. For $7.50, are you going to complain?
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but runs very hot
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well and the read/write speeds are good too but it gets very hot. I am always fearful that my expensive large capacity micro SD might get damaged with the heat so i copy fewer files at a time and make sure i am not copying like 128 GB of data at one time. The reader is good but beware of the temps as it gets burning hot.
customer_reviews.author: Arslan

customer_reviews.title: Runs very hot
customer_reviews.text: No complaints on the speed which allowed me to get the max rated specs for my sd card. However, after few minutes in the USB port it was hot (and not just warm) to the touch. Hot enough to be painful or feel like a minor burn. I will likely be returning as I don't trust this to be plugged in for any length of time. I suppose for quick transfers where you won't leave it plugged in it's fine. It did this in multiple different USB ports and with different sd cards.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hyman

customer_reviews.title: Last a few months and then dies...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased one of these and the second time it has died. 1st one last around a year; this one 4 months. When using it to transfer at USB 3 speeds it gets really hot. Then it one day just dies. Perhaps they should make vent holes to prevent it from overheating. Or even a mode with a fan, or possibly a different form factor so it can breathe. Whatever the case, I won't be buying another one again, or any product made by Transcend ever, ever again.
customer_reviews.author: CWeb

customer_reviews.title: Simple as can be + works perfecty with Linux
customer_reviews.text: This little contraption just works, perfectly. I use Linux. HowTo: Inserted (micro) memory card into this, plugged the reader into one of the USB3 slots on my linux desktop. 'udiskd' which runs in the background, detected the event and auto-mounted the device on /media/myname/404B-CBD9/ (I saw it appear in the 'dolphin' file viewer). A quick copy of some *.mp3 files to the mounted media device later, I had all the music on the card (took less than 1 minute for almost 300 files). Finally, unplugged the Transcend from the computer, and moved the card to a, switched the DOSS to 'tf' (memory card) mode and it plays my music from the card.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Day

customer_reviews.title: Little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I got this card reader so I could get the files off of the micro SD card that goes in my portable voice recorder for my podcast. Works great! I also found a bunch of old regular SD cards and didn't know what was on them, so used this to save a bunch of old photos I'd forgotten about from 2 cameras ago. The cards do go in upside down, which isn't terribly obvious at first. otherwise, Extremely handy!
customer_reviews.author: Harper O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: suspect--I am blaming this for frying three micro SD cards, though I cannot be sure.
customer_reviews.text: I am blaming this for frying three micro SD cards, though I cannot be sure. Three different high end cards failed and had to be tossed. Maybe they heated up while copying larger files? don't know and will not use this any more. No issues with other similar devices from different manufacturers. Read some more reviews and see if there are any similar I guess.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-K

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, though not without concerns
customer_reviews.text: The little device is okay. It's an SD card reader. My biggest concern is that, as has been stated elsewhere, this thing runs hot. If you're moving data for a long enough time, the reader reaches temperatures it probably shouldn't. I fear that things might actually start to melt, but so far they haven't. I doubt this is standard in all SD card readers, but since I am unsure, I'll keep the rating in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Drachen

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine except for micro SD
customer_reviews.text: I was not able to get the micro SD slot to work, but luckily I had the adapter to use the regular SD. Once I used the adapter, the regular SD slot worked well. It is good for the price, not worth going through a return process just because the micro SD slot didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: James Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot and probably takes too much power from your port.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertized, but it gets hot. Really hot sometimes during long transfers. Even when idle it gets warm though. The heat alone doesn't bother me (it won't burn you), but that's an indication that it's taking a lot of power from USB. This is probably okay if it's plugged directly into your computer but I worry that when used in an unpowered hub (which is how i use it) combined with other devices it may draw too much current for my port. This is probably the "interference" issue other reviewers stated. As a result, I don't ever leave the reader plugged in, which makes it a hassle to use.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer1

customer_reviews.title: Gets way to hot!
customer_reviews.text: I also have the larger Transcend USB 3 Reader (Transcend USB 3.0 Super Speed Multi-Card Reader for SD/SDHC/SDXC/MS/CF Cards (TS-RDF8K)) which is great but this smaller unit get really....really hot! I won't leave it plugged in as it makes me nervous due to the heat it generates--It is more than warm to the touch! I will use it in my camera bag for occasional on-the-go needs, but will use the Super Multi-Card Reader on my home computer as it does not seem to get hot like this smaller unit.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang UngerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Cheap Card Reader
customer_reviews.text: This is a great card reader if you are looking for something cheap and usable. It feels very thin/hollow and there is no click/push in bounce (like in cameras) for the slots - you kinda just have to shove it in there and it feels very tight; but it works very well non-the-less and the transfer speeds are great with 3.0 If you are looking for a reader to just keep in your bag and use then I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: DotTech

customer_reviews.title: Fast and works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite SD card reader I've ever owned, which is a weird thing to decide favorites of probably. It's sleek and attractively designed due to its simplicity but for some reason I can't get the microSD reader slot on it to work whatsoever. I can get around this by using a microSD-to-SD adapter like the kind that gets bundled with microSDs all the time, but not being able to use the actual built-in microSD slot is a letdown. Other than that tho it's fast and snappy and clicking the plastic sleeve over the USB plug on the end provides hours of entertainment if you have nothing better to do.
customer_reviews.author: Gorogoro-kun

customer_reviews.title: wide as hell
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think about it, but this thing is so wide that it hits my pc case and cannot fit into any of my usb ports. I can only halfway fit it into one of my usb 3 pots on the frontside of my pc case and it goes in enough to work, but not reliably. Besides that, it works? It does what it's supposed to. I put my sd card in and copied files back and forth. Transferred fast. It's just too big to be guaranteed to fit in usb ports in computer cases without a gap on either side of the port to accommodate its size.
customer_reviews.author: shoelaceninja

customer_reviews.title: Great and compact microSD/SD card reader
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid SD/microSD reader. I have several embedded devices that I back up and service regularly. This is tiny and works as advertised. I don't have all the stats for speed of writes and reads, but I can say it's much faster than USB 2.0. You can get the numbers from another review. It supports up to UHS-1, so if that's a problem, you can find a faster device elsewhere on Amazon. It's great for travel. I always pack one of these things in case of a camera disaster and I have yet to use one, but the day I don't pack it is the day it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Flounder

customer_reviews.title: Outside = Sucks. Inside = Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously fast... and I'm using Class10 cards. My only complaint is that there is nowhere to put the end cap while you have it off, and there is nowhere to attach a cord or lanyard - overall the back end of this thing is a lot of wasted space that could have been better utilized for something. I lied... I have another complaint. The plastic shell is on the fat side, which makes it hard to have things plugged in next to it. But it's what's on the inside that counts... right? Yeah... sure... for that price I'll pretend. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Privacy Concerns

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Quickly connected to both my Mac and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Quickly connected to both my Mac and PC. Has 2 Slots, one for SD and one for Micro SD. In both cases the card sticks out. You can only put one card in at a time, clearly states on the box "Doesn't allow simultaneous reading of 2 cards". You really don't need USB 3.0 since i think its speed is capped at 60 mbs.
customer_reviews.author: Ramy Fathi

customer_reviews.title: Great device that doesn't block adjacent USB ports.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, and ever since using it for the first time on vacation, it's become one of my must-haves when traveling with my laptop. There's not much to be said about an outstanding product with nearly zero flaws, other than the important bit - I'm able to plug this into one of two side-by-side USB ports on my laptop and can STILL fit another regular USB mouse plug in the other port.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase this product so that I could pull the pictures/videos from various SD/Micro SD cards. I could not do this before purchasing because my SD slot on my macbook didn't work. This works very well, it's fast and versatile to handle both types of cards. It completely saved my ability to do the work I need to do with the files that I captured. I'm a beginner videographer and desperately needed a way to access my content.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: So relieved!
customer_reviews.text: Had a minor meltdown when my old cell's SD card randomly corrupted. I had no luck with other card readers but this was super cheap so I bought it as a last ditch effort and I'm so pleased! This reader along with the free software recovered about 98% of the thousands of photos I had on my old card. It took ages (something like 6 hours I think?) but it was well worth it for all the memories it saved. Whether you're looking to use this simply to read intact cards to recover corrupted data I would very highly recommend this. It worked a miracle for me.
customer_reviews.author: MTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Gets Very Hot
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this reader for about four years and it has performed well transferring photos from my Sandisk SD cards to PC. I've noticed lately that the reader gets very hot very quickly when plugged into my desktop PC. It is now so bad I no longer want to trust it with my pricey high speed SD cards--not to mention my expensive PC.
customer_reviews.author: Pileated

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and fast SD reader
customer_reviews.text: Plugs in and windows (10) automatically installed the appropriate drivers. Made transferring files from one card to the next much easier since my laptop only has one memory reader slot. The support for both standard and micro SD is also very clever; No more searching for an adaptor. Windows interprets the drive like any other USB stick. It doesn't know it has an SD card inside and doesn't care. Like any storage device, some drive maintenance may be required in windows manager. For some reason, it wanted to be drive D which, of course, disabled my DVD drive. Giving it a different letter fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob November

customer_reviews.title: Good until it isn't
customer_reviews.text: This got really hot one day and stopped working. I'm lucky it didn't take out the SD card or my USB port with it. It was only used about once a week on average. Just for fun I plugged it into a USB power supply and measured it with my infrared temperature gun, certain areas were reaching over 200 degrees Fahrenheit.
customer_reviews.author: playcat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and excellent transfer speeds
customer_reviews.text: This memory card reader is a perfect match with the memory card for my digital camera. Using a USB 3.0 slot I'm able to transfer hundreds of photos quickly which gets me into the editing process faster. An excellent product overall. One small improvement I would like is a way to snap the cover onto the back of the reader. Or have some other way to keep the cover attached to the device. Right now I just have the cover sitting by itself and I'm constantly having to guard it from my curious cat.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Easterbrooks

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I feared that this was a flimsy, low-quality product. Thankfully, my fears were unfounded. The card reader was instantly recognized by my computer when I plugged it into the USB 3.0 port. I had no issues accessing the videos stored on my micro SD. The reader is a good size because it takes up minimal real estate on the side of my laptop. When I'm not using it I don't even notice that it's there. I would recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I like the small and smooth form factor
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times so far, but it functions perfectly. I like the small and smooth form factor, as I can easily store this in my travel camera bag without giving up valuable space. Additionally, the USB connector has a firmly fitting cap on it that protects that end, and won't fall off if its loose in a bag. Very pleased with this, and data transfer rates are about what I would expect (based on patience level, not actual data).
customer_reviews.author: D. Kaul

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hobby sports photographer and I use SD cards constantly! Well, our computer SD slot stopped working and I instantly thought that I'd have to buy a new computer just for that. Thankfully, my husband said there were adapters for USB ports. I found this one. So affordable, I was skeptical that it would work. When it arrived it was nicely packaged and, to my amazement, worked great!! I would highly recommend this product to everyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T

customer_reviews.title: The was out of date 10 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Disgracefully under-powered machine. Perhaps they could claim some place in the firmament of PCs for the Atom CPU, but NOT running Windows. There is just so much (or so little) that a CPU designed to power digital watches can do. And this CANNOT handle Windows 10! I watched this little unit try for 4 days to perform an update to the newest version. It failed every attempt. Slowly. So be warned: this product tries to be a PC. It cannot. It tries to run Windows 10. IT CANNOT. You should not even consider purchasing it. I did. I'm angry and sorry that I did. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: P Johannson

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great size; easy to carry with you. Works wonderfully. I keep it with my Zip drives and of course, it stands out above the rest. It’s a different size and color. I love it. Just take your memory card from your camera; put in TRANSCEND USB; and plug TRANSCEND into computer. You can then transfer your photos easily.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Green

customer_reviews.title: I used this reader for concerts for several years with ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this reader for concerts for several years with almost no complaints. It's very compact, and fairly fast for the price Only reason I'm not using it now is because I upgraded to the new Macbook pro, which uses USB C instead of 3.0. My only gripe is that it's so wide that it blocks any adjacent ports. This made it impossible to use while having the power cable and a thunderbolt hard drive plugged in. I was forced to choose one or the other. Usually I had to unplug my computer while importing, then plug it back in after it was done. Overall, it wasn't too big of a deal, so I can overlook it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Simpson

customer_reviews.title: 4.8 Stars for a trustworthy performer!
customer_reviews.text: This 3.0 reader only allows you to insert a SD and a MicroSD card, but works very well! You have to insert the MicroSD card upside down. It can only read 1 card at a time. Actually only 1 card inserted at a time. So you won't be able to copy from one card to another directly. My Lexar 633x 64GB MicroSD card reached 89MB/s read and 28MB/s write. Much improved over my laptop built-in SD card reader which only reached 21MB/s and 17MB/s. Excellent value at $7 with add-on. I predict I will lost that stupid cap very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: So far so good - it does what it promises. My only concern is that like others have mentioned, it tends to get a little warm when in use. However, I only use it 5-10 minutes at a time transferring files, then I remove it, so it's not a problem for me. If you were planning on using it as more of a main drive/always in use, then it's probably not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little device.
customer_reviews.text: I keep one of these in a small pocket in my backpack. I liked and used it until I lost it and had to replace it. Since losing my first one I've purchased 2 of these (one to carry around and the other to leave at home), and I'll continue to buy this particular card reader for as long as they continue to make it. I really like the snap on enclosure for the USB end which protects the connector while not in use. Transfer speeds appear to be limited only by the speed of the card being read or written to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works well and the price is right
customer_reviews.text: Not much to dislike. Plug it in and it works. My computer's card reader quit working and I was considering buying a new computer. This cheap bit of electronics solved my problem. On a side issue I ordered a similar device from another co. After seeing this on Amazon I tried to cancel that order about one hour after placing it on a Sunday. No luck. Amazon however, is great about quick delivery and great prices.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent card reader, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had USB 3.0 ports on my computer since 3.0 first came out, and so I finally bought this to "get with the times"! This works perfectly because I don't otherwise have a card reader. I haven't had any issues whatsoever, always smooth operation. I bought a 64gb micro sd card with standard size adapter to go with it, and it's been smooth sailing. I only need one, but otherwise I would order more if necessary! If you don't have USB 3.0 ports (blue, or else have "SS" next to the port) then this won't work to its full potential. You most likely need a USB 2.0 card reader.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Great media card reader!
customer_reviews.text: After I finished building my new PC, I came to the realization that I was going to be in need of a media card reader to transfer files from my camera to the PC. I had taken this for granted with the laptop I had because it had one built in, so I had to figure something out relatively fast. This USB Card reader has worked without issue since it was purchased, although it does get a bit warm while it's in the USB port. Transfer speeds are fast and it has worked with regular SD cards as well as a micro SD as well, so I have no faults to report.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Kreal

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I had hoped it would
customer_reviews.text: Great little gadget! Love that it can be used for a regular size and a micro SD card. I use mine mainly to view footage from my dash CAM that is recorded onto a micro SD card. I just plug it into my computer and open the files and presto! There are my recordings! Very simple plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Initial D speeds, stuns, and wows
customer_reviews.text: Son, let me tell you right now this is good stuff right here. First SD card I tried was a Sandisk SDSDU-016G-A11; has a 30MB/s READ speed and I maxed out about 46MB/s WRITE speed, averaged around the 40's. God dang, I don't even know. Others' CrystalDiskMark tests are around 10MB/s write speed. Second card was a Lexar LSD64GCRBNA1000; Others' CDM tests are from ~70-87MB/s write speeds. I maxed out about 86.7MB/s, averaged around 65-75. I don't really recall. Transferred 30GB in less than 10 minutes so the average must've been higher than 60MB/s for sure.
customer_reviews.author: KBS

customer_reviews.title: Beware of f
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. SD and Micro SD cards have a lot of wiggle room when you insert them into this device. I've never actually gotten a micro SD card to work in this; I always have to stick it in an micro-to-SD adapter and use the standard SD card slot. I can't understand how this has so many good reviews. Fake review sites predict this has only 30% fake reviews, but it seems more like 90% to me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction, offers no protection for card inserted and no improvement in speed over usb2
customer_reviews.text: Slow even in usb3, no improvement over built in sd port on notebook w/msd adapter. No difference in testing class 10 through U3, just slow. Puts mSD card at great risk hanging out of side. Would have expected better construction and for the size at least hold the card entirely inside the device even if it took a manual paperclip eject. Must still lug around a case to put the card in for protection when not precariously hanging out the side of this crunchy thin plastic. Seems to overheat and screech to a halt with a large single file transfer.
customer_reviews.author: jdoebean

customer_reviews.title: Slower Than USB 3.0 Transcend I purchased in 2015
customer_reviews.text: Using multiple SD and Mini SD chips, this USB 3.1 converter transmits data SLOWER than the Transcend of same shape and size purchased in 2105. ??? Odd, isn't it? Tried it in multiple usb ports too - all instances it was slower. WOW! I guess you have to go backwards to move forward.
customer_reviews.author: Tomxypdq

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Works great, Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Compact and works! This is a great Card Reader. USB 3.0 works great and allows for fast data transfer rates compared to slow 2.0 type readers. It has Micro SD and SD slots making it easy to keep track of one reader that accepts multiple types of cards rather than having multiple card readers. It's been working great for a week now, and I don't expect any issues out of it. The build quality is also nice, the fit and finish is as expected. Not sharp corners, or plastic mold issues from the manufacturing process. A+!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these little things now. They stay true to the speed of your micro SD card when making transfers while every PC I connected to recognized it immediately. Going on a year strong on my first unit and when I needed another definitely chose transcend. Price to performance can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the micro SD card is not spring loaded.
customer_reviews.text: It's at a great price point. It works okay. The only thing I don't like is that when you insert the micro SD card it is not held in place with a spring-loaded mechanism. Other competing brands have a spring-loading mechanism so you know the card is inserted correctly and they hold it in place. This product does not.
customer_reviews.author: Metrologist

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool
customer_reviews.text: When I switched computers from Mac to PC, I presumed that I gave it enough thought to cover my bases. Not true.i forgot about using camera cards to import digital photos. I needed something small and highly functional, something I could plug into the front of my computer. I put this little gizmo to work the second it arrived. It works with my hand scanner (micro SD), my camera (sdxc) and my photo archive backup on SDHC. Does what it says, works great. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Montage

customer_reviews.title: Not EVEN usef
customer_reviews.text: Have to return the reader because it only has a connection to a charger and no connection to a computer, smartphone, tablet and no way to see what might be on the SD card. I'm disabled and I need things to be accessable and this reader is not accessable for any human being.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia O.

customer_reviews.title: Reads my Class 10 SDHC card very quickly, makes shooting in RAW mode an enjoyable wait free experience
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in and it instantly appears in the finder on my Mac. Then I'm able to transfer the images to my Mac super quickly. Since I shoot only in RAW on my DSLR the images are large. With the class 10 SDHC card I am using with this, there is virtually no wait to transfer these large images. That's exactly why I purchased this reader and it has met every expectation I had of it. An additional nice feature is the included cap that goes over the USB plug, this will prevent dust and debris from getting in the plug. Overall I have no complaints, this is an excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: docprego

customer_reviews.title: Has the tendency to escape when not supervised.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked great as shown, but it has run away one day when I was looking for the adapter. It's probably because I wasnt able to add any keychains on it and the animal control patrol took it to a shady adoption center that's hard to find. When you get the product, make sure to put on a leash, or put it in a dedicated den so it won't escape.
customer_reviews.author: Potato

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sent me a used one
customer_reviews.text: It does work and seems to be a good product. Keep in mind that I removed a star because of Amazon, and not because of the product itself. It was sold and shipped by Amazon. Amazon sent a used one, instead of new as advertised. The packaging had been torn open, and stapled back together. I need it right now, and have already been using it, so I won't be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P Bradley

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like about this item isn't even a fault in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I've not had any problems with this device, though I've only used it with my SD cards. The USB port doesn't wiggle when I plug it in, and my PC always recognizes the cards instantly. The only thing I don't like about this item isn't even a fault in the product itself: the USB ports on the front of my PC are horizontal, so when I plug it in and the card sticks out horizontally, it doesn't fit very well - it hits the side of my PC case. So, just make sure you have some room near your USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Solid Stable Connect
customer_reviews.text: This USB Port provides a stable connection for standard and Micro SD Card Formats and allows you to transfer a whole bunch of information in one time. I used this to transfer my 128GB SD card files and migrate phone SD Cards perfectly without any major mishaps.
customer_reviews.author: Iyiahn

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt seem to work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these one from kingston (i believe) and this one. The sd card on this one comes out the side so it can be difficult to plug in with other usb devices on the computer. It also seems to have broken after a few weeks and I have just been using the other one as it has a top load for the sd card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable SD card reader!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I bought this reader and didn't go with the expensive brands with too many features. This one is great for what I need it for. It does not corrupt data like the last one I had either. It can get kind of hot though, so I do let it cool. I've seen transfer speeds of 60 MPBS which I think is the max for what I use. Highly recommended, and I always tell all my friends to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: cheap and good?  I'm in!
customer_reviews.text: purchased on amazon July 12, 2016 after struggling for over a year with an old mostly broken cheapo chinese card reader I've had for years - I decided "they can't be expensive even for a nice one let me take a look" and stumbled upon this Transcend cardreader. I was a fool for not grabbing it sooner! well made, looks nice, and has worked well with our class 10 cards we use in our camera. its a no-brainer whether i'd recommend this against any cheaper counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: bambambigelow

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Got both SD and MicroSD cards and need to transfer files? This little reader will get the job done. Plug the card in, plug the reader in to your computer, you're ready to go. It's that simple. Not too big that it takes up too much drawer space but not small enough where it will get lost in the void. Overall, a great product that'll get a mundane task done easily.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Full-size SD and Micro SD reader that does the job well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an ancient SanDisk SD card reader stick I had that was struggling to read/write some newer SD and Micro SD cards I had bought. This works great and doesn't even need an adapter for Micro SD cards. My computers are older so they don't have USB 3.0, but this is very fast even on USB 2.0 ports. The price is right and I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Transfer!!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast transfer from my SD cards over to my desktop. Well I bought a new desktop and long behold still does not have an SD card slot on it. So I purchased Transcend card reader to download my cameras. I normally get a 100mbs transfer speeds and never seem to wait long for the pictures to come over. It does get a little hot when left in the USB slot but seems to not affect performance.
customer_reviews.author: FixItDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Very simple`
customer_reviews.text: I had around 60gb of photos and videos on my SD card and now that a few years have gone by, my computer no longer supports an SD card slot. Rather, I found this to be a great solution for uploading all of my photos onto my computer for easy access. It transfers data very quickly and never crashed once during the process.
customer_reviews.author: Rubark Established 2014

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool if your computer doesn't have the slots!!
customer_reviews.text: If your computer or laptop don't have SD card readers, this thing is great. Just pop them in (one at a time I'm assuming, haven't tried more than one at a time) and put USB end into your computer. Recognizes it just like a USB drive. I use it to backup pictures from SD card camera and for backing up the micro SD card from my phone
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: works as it should
customer_reviews.text: The piece feels kind of flimsy, but it works great i cap my 100MB/s SD cards copying data from it, have no issues with it at all, even in a usb 2.0 slot you get 20+MB/s which is nice. side note: you can only have one card in it at a time. i might have to get a couple more and a hub so i can offload video more quickly as i film with 3 cameras at any given time. not that it was expected to i was just hopeful it would lol.
customer_reviews.author: wagex

customer_reviews.title: Physical size, hardware shape and design is a poorly thought out disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Right off the bat, physically, I don't like that: - the SD cards go in what I consider upside down. Seems unintuitive to me to insert them with the gold contacts facing up. - the body is too wide, compared to typical thumb drives I have. So I have to unplug my printer USB, as it blocks, since my Acer laptop have the USB ports side by side, but other thumb drives can go in and out with printer cable in place. - I'm used to having a way to put the cap on the back of the drive, like a pen cap on the back of a pen. This one, I will probably lose the cap after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: wew

customer_reviews.title: Great item for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is very useful. I find myself using this rather than the jack that is built into my computer. The transfer speeds with this Transcend adapter are surprisingly fast. Only downside is that it is not built like a tank, but as long as you are careful with it, for the price...it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: This one is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase this item because the last one I purchased stopped working after a few days. It wasn't this brand nor was it made as well as this one is. This works like a charm, plug it in with the cards loaded and it reads them quickly and no having to jiggle it to get it to work. Better made than other ones I have had where the usb plug isn't so secure.
customer_reviews.author: C. Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: The few products I've owned from Transcend are usually of great quality, and this one is no exception. There is not much to say about it since it is a simple product with just a couple of capabilities, but it does its job perfectly! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: beli8

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I expected it to!
customer_reviews.text: Reads SD cards? Check. Reads microSD cards? Check. Reads microSD cards in SD converters? Check. Having said that, it works exactly as it's supposed to. Though, I'm not very particular about speed so I can't comment on it being 3.0. But for the average user migrating large media files, and one who's not super nitpicky about speeds 'cause they're always on the go, it works great. Heads up for those wondering: it cannot read SD and microSD at the same time. Not that I needed it to...I was just curious.
customer_reviews.author: shopping_for_noobs

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It works pretty fast when connected to a usb 3.0 port. Obviously it will slow depending on the speed of your card. Sometimes it won't get the card so you have to unplug it and then plug it again. Not a big deal, however could be dangerous could accidentally erase your card, so be carefull.
customer_reviews.author: THX

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, seems reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews had me a bit nervous so I'll be sure to update if there's any issues but I was very pleased with how fast this drive is. I had no issues with transferring large amounts of data but should any issues arise I'll be sure to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D'Auria

customer_reviews.title: Is too wide for my HP Pavillion laptop
customer_reviews.text: won't fit next to my wireless mouse USB nano receiver, but I'm keeping it to use as a backup (can use with my EagleTec USB 4 Port Hub in the end port) since my 1st IOGear converter is problematic & an older 2.0 version. I especially like the appearance (I got the white one), compared to other similar products. Plan to contact Transcend to ask them if they have or intend to make one just like this one, but narrower.
customer_reviews.author: David Hand

customer_reviews.title: Amazing storage for the money
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly and transfers data fairly quickly thanks to it being USB 3.0. I originally bought this because I wanted to transfer data to my card faster and my computer did not have a native microSD/SD card slot. One thing that does bug me about this is that you can only use one slot at a time (either the microSD or the SD slot). Overall I am happy with this product and plan on buying another one to have a spare. I have been using this for a few months and it works well. Amazing amount of storage (128GB) for the money
customer_reviews.author: kyle tunnell

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I'm still using older gear but here are my impressions. Moved (cut) 24 GB of movie clips from microSD card>microSD slot on RDF5>desktop front USB 2.0 port>cat6>DS211j NAS. Took ~23 minutes, averaged +/- 19 MB/sec. Didn't notice any heat issues..
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect alternative to the SD adapter.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly and transfers data fairly quickly thanks to it being USB 3.0. I originally bought this because I wanted to transfer data to my card faster and my computer did not have a native microSD/SD card slot. One thing that does bug me about this is that you can only use one slot at a time (either the microSD or the SD slot). Overall I am happy with this product and plan on buying another one since I lost this one a while back.
customer_reviews.author: axsolorz

customer_reviews.title: USB slap bent easily within a couple of days
customer_reviews.text: Within about 2 days the metal USB connector was bent at about a 45 degree angle, just from average moving about and using it. I've learned not to bend these things back because often it destroys the very solder points and connections between the USB slab and what's inside. So I can't put the cap back on it any more, can't carry it in my bag any more, and it's a delicate patient sitting in a safe place for when I really need it. Why can't more USB items have a solid securing of the metal slap to withstand a bit of random pressure which is inevitable with things sticking out the side of laptops?
customer_reviews.author: Vandweller in the Northwest

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use!  Great for the price, but pretty slow for a USB 3.0 device.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cut-and-dry product, and it works. A couple of minor flaws: first, it fits loose in the USB port, so, when you are trying to shove a card in there, it tends to rock or even come out, which is annoying. Second, it is barely any faster than the USB 2.0 reader I was replacing. You need to spend more money if you want the super-duper fast type of card reader. On the plus side, it has transferred hundreds of gigabytes of images and videos without hiccuping, so that's great! It also didn't require any drivers, and works with Windows 10 and Lightroom just fine.
customer_reviews.author: SlushierCashewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: If all you use is SD & Micro SD this device is a great buy for you.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to replace an older USB 2.0 device that was really bulky in size as well. This device is nice to look at & a great size to put away when not in use. It also fits nicely in my PC with having other USB devices plugged into it above and below. The USB 3.0 transfer speeds are far superior to the older USB 2.0 device I was using. This device is recognized by my PC instantly and creates the new drive prior to inserting your memory media. Besides the ease of use, great look, fast transfer speeds, the low low price was the deciding factor to other devices i was looking at.
customer_reviews.author: edziu76

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, and very fast.
customer_reviews.text: The built-in SD reader in my Dell XPS 15 won't work after upgrading to Windows 10 (thanks Mr. Dell!). No fix seems to be in the works. So, I had to get an external adapter to transfer photos to my computer(s). This small, lightweight adapter is very fast. Just what I wanted and expected. I've only had it a short time but don't expect any durability problems. It will sit in my briefcase along with all my other travel essentials such as a USB hub, Cat-5 cable, etc. And I'll likely buy another to keep in my camera bag. It weighs almost nothing, and is so small I fear I might misplace it.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Zatarain

customer_reviews.title: Simple, basic and quick - I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, while this is what I required, I wasn't as sure this would end up being the correct one for me - that said, it worked perfectly for all my SD-based cards; with support for SDHC (UHS-I), SDXC (UHS-I), micro SD, micro SDHC (UHS-I), and micro SDXC (UHS-I), that covers the gamut of my use and reason fulfilling also the need for portability as well. Oh and value for the price, as of this review still under $7 Prime. Phones, tablets, DAPs and cameras in descending order of equipment using the cards, whether downloading from or uploading to, this device FIT met all my file shifting needs.
customer_reviews.author: music_monger

customer_reviews.title: It Works, But There Are Issues
customer_reviews.text: It works, but there are two things I definitely don't like about it: 1) It is too wide. It cannot plug in next to another USB device on my computer; it's one or the other. 2) Windows 10 complains every time I plug a MicroSD in using this adapter: "there is problem with (name varies)". As I said, the drive then works okay, but it's a little disconcerting.
customer_reviews.author: The Dabbler

customer_reviews.title: High quality, Fast Card Reader at an Attractive Price Point
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this card reader to transfer video files between my DJI Phantom 3 Advanced quadcopter and my PC. This is a no-frills, inexpensive card reader that is high quality despite its low price point. It's small and does not take up much room plugged into my PC, and the USB 3.0 connection provides reliably fast transfer speeds, which is great when you're transferring 2.7K video files. One of the other reasons I chose this particular card reader is that it only reads SD and micro SD cards, which allows it to be so small. Other card readers can read CF cards, but they're much bulkier, and I can't imagine ever needing to read one.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Bricked on transfer
customer_reviews.text: After browsing my files successfully I was able to transfer 83.8MB of photo and video before my computer no longer recognized the input and corrupted the remaining 30GB on my mircoSD card. With all the glowing reviews I was hoping for the best but seem to have a combination of the worst luck and a bad stick. After reformatting the card it is transferring back and forth as normal, a tragedy to my lost files.
customer_reviews.author: jeff yoders

customer_reviews.title: Worked Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, I do not get paid to write reviews. I also did not receive this product for free in exchange for a good review. I have a dash cam that uses a micro SD card and I recently needed to pull footage of a drunk driver that almost hit me. Although it is USB 3.0, it worked perfectly in a 2.0 slot. It recognized immediately and it worked flawlessly. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Wathan48

customer_reviews.title: A Good SD Card Reader!
customer_reviews.text: Transcend were among the first SD Cards I ever bought and I still have them, although at 1GB apiece they're not very useful anymore. Still Transcend makes good stuff, and when I needed a new portable USB SD Card Reader, this Transcend made the Cut. I give it only 4/5 stars for 1 reason. For whatever reason, It will not read 1 card I have. It's a SanDisk, and I can read any other card. But this one I have to use one of my other USB readers on. Other than that, it's fast to download and upload data and works well.
customer_reviews.author: J Doe

customer_reviews.title: Works with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.text: Works with Windows 10. My onboard reader is fine but Windows 10 doesn't support it. This solved that problem in a pinch!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davidson

product_meta.title: Transcend TS-RDF5K USB 3.1 SDHC/SDXC/microSDHC/SDXC Card Reader, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe Transcend USB 3.1 SD & microSD card reader is able to transfer images, videos, and other files from SD & microSD card formats (SDHC/SDXC/UHS-I/UHS-3). this reader is compatible with super-speed USB 3.1 interface (backward compatible with USB 2.0) and features an LED status light. Compatible with both Windows and Mac platforms.
feature_bullets: SuperSpeed USB 3.1 interface; backwards compatible with USB 2.0
Memory Card Supported- SDHC (UHS-I), SDXC (UHS-I), microSD, microSDHC (UHS-I), and microSDXC (UHS-I)
LED card insertion and data transfer activity indicator. This card reader will work with UHS-II cards, but only operates at UHS-I speeds
Ideal for transferring high-resolution images and video recordings
Offers a free download of RecoveRx data recovery software

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars17,408 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
